column4: .............now what was that mfw................. i need the what, and your sure that will make konqueror my default file browser
making konq default in gnome is kind of - pushing s**t uphill IMO
if you prefer konq you are better off with KDE
then install kubuntu-desktop and use KDE :)
do "apt-cache search file-browser" perhaps - I use rox here for example
ah - you can fix that
in prefs -behaviour - "open in browser windows"
that will give you the traditional view with back arrows etc
there was a holy war about it ;)
not so much ubuntu - it was a gnome thing
much angry bandidth was wasted over it ;)
in hoary extras - I would comment them out after you get the codecs, personally
wise move :)
try totem-xine
the xine backend for totem works better atm
don't be alarmed if it wants to uninstall ubuntu-desktop - that's just a metapackage
totem is just the pretty face - -xine is the engine :)
1) help to understand the file 2) disables stuff you don't want
in some files that is a comment too
if you don't know, you don't need it :)
apt-cache show pure-ftpd
